title: Designing Student-Centered Mathematics Learning Environments for Adult Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Requires a flexible learning structure considering smartphone-centric accessibility and asynchronous learning materials.

learning_goals: Learners can apply mathematical thinking and problem-solving strategies to address real-life problems.

Learners participate in weekly 60-minute discussion sessions with 3–4 peers on mathematical concepts (e.g., functions, equations, statistics), debate three or more alternative problem-solving methods based on pre-provided materials, and submit a report meeting 80% or higher of a five-level rubric (participation, logic, creativity, etc.).
Learners can establish self-directed learning plans and reflect on their learning progress.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
